title: Footie badboy Adriano celebrates turning 35 with exclusive £78,000 Rio party with free bar and luxury food
text:
Birthday bonanza Footie badboy Adriano celebrates turning 35 with exclusive £78,000 Rio party with free bar and luxury food 
400 people have been invited to the Brazilian's birthday bash in his hometown By Richard Forrester Comments FOOTBALL badboy Adriano is throwing the mother of all birthday parties. 
The former Inter Milan striker is splashing out a staggering £78,000 to celebrate turning 35 – and 400 people are invited. Instagram @adrianoimperador 4 Adriano has spent £78,000 on a lavish birthday party for 400 guests 
Known as ‘the Emperor’ from his time in Italy, Adriano will celebrate his bash in his hometown, the Tijuca neighbourhood in Brazil’s capital Rio de Janeiro. 
The lucky 400 people who are invited will receive free drink and luxury food as Adriano holds back no expense. 
It is not the first time that the Brazilian with his thunderous left foot has splashed a fortune of cash as he gained a reputation for being a wild man. 
In 2015 he reportedly booked out an entire hotel in Rio so he could invite 18 escorts back. He apparently paid around £25,000 for the privilege. But it hasn’t always been all glitz and glamour for the ex-Roma star. 
Battles with alcohol and binge eating following the tragic death of his father meant he was remarkably placed under house arrest by his club Corinthians in order to sort out his lavish lifestyle. 
Adriano, who grew up in Brazil’s notoriously poor favelas, won four Serie A titles with Inter Milan alongside two Coppa Italias.
